label: ISE ANC Apply Endpoint Policy By MAC Address Example
info:
This sample applies a Cisco Adaptive Network Control (ANC) policy to an
endpoint via DXL and Cisco pxGrid. The sample identifies the endpoint by its MAC
address. The payload from the response received for the Cisco pxGrid request is
printed to the Node-RED `debug` tab.

### Prerequisites

* The samples configuration step has been completed (see the
  [DXL Configuration Sample](https://github.com/opendxl/node-red-contrib-dxl/wiki/Client-Configuration)).
* The DXL fabric to which the client will connect has been bridged to Cisco
  pxGrid.
* The DXL client associated with the `Apply quarantine policy to endpoint` node has been authorized to perform `DXL Cisco pxGrid Queries`
  (see [Authorize Client to Use Cisco pxGrid via DXL](https://opendxl.github.io/opendxl-pxgrid-client-python/pydoc/pxgridauth.html)).
* An ANC policy named `quarantine_policy` has been configured. The policy
  could be created by logging into the ISE web interface and performing the
  following steps:

  * Navigate to **Operations** ▶ **Adaptive Network Control** ▶ 
    **Policy List**.
  * On the **List** screen, click on the **Add** button.
  * On the **List** ▶ **New** screen, enter `quarantine_policy` in the
    **name** field, select `QUARANTINE` in the **Action** field, and press
    the **Submit** button.

### Setup

* Edit the `Specify MAC address` node and modify the `Payload` property with the
  MAC address of an endpoint for which to apply the `quarantine_policy`.
  For example:

  ```
  00:11:22:33:44:55
  ```

* To deploy the flow, press the `Deploy` button in the upper-right corner of the
  screen. If Node-RED is able to properly connect to the DXL fabric, a green dot
  with the word `connected` should appear under the
  `Apply quarantine policy to endpoint` node.

### Running

To exercise the flow, double-click the button on the left side of the
`Specify MAC address` node.

### Output

If the policy can be applied successfully, the following message will be
displayed to the Node-RED `debug` tab:

```
▶ { ancStatus: "success" }
```

If the policy has already been associated with the endpoint before the example
is run, the flow is halted with an `error.message` similar to the following:

```
mac address is already associated with this policy error associated mac 00:11:22:33:44:55
```

If the policy has not been defined before the example is run, the flow is halted
with an `error.message` similar to the following:

```
Policy is not configured error associated with mac 00:11:22:33:44:55
```

### Details

The flow exercises the nodes below.

#### Specify MAC address

This is an `inject` input node which starts the flow. This node injects a new
message with a `payload` property which specifies the MAC address of an endpoint.

#### Set MAC address request parameter

This is a `change` node which copies the value from the `payload` message
property to the `macAddress` property. The `Apply quarantine policy to endpoint`
node uses the `macAddress` property when constructing the parameters for the
Cisco pxGrid apply endpoint policy request. 

#### Apply quarantine policy to endpoint

This is an `ise anc apply endpoint policy by mac` node. This node connects to
the DXL fabric and sends a DXL `Request` message to Cisco pxGrid service to
apply the policy to the endpoint.

The request message includes the `macAddress` property set by the
`Set MAC address request parameter` node.

The `Policy name` property is set to "quarantine_policy".

The `Return` property is set to "a parsed JSON object" to indicate that the
payload for the response should be added to the output message as a JavaScript
object decoded from JSON.

#### Output result

This is a `debug` output node. This node outputs the `payload` set on the
message by the `Apply quarantine policy to endpoint` node. If the apply
endpoint policy request succeeded, the object written to the Node-RED `debug`
window should contain a property with a key of "ancStatus" and associated value
of "success".
